sentences.english: English government seems to have been swathed in red tape at its birth.
sentences.chinese: 英國政府似乎從誕生之日起，就受官樣文章的束縛。

sentences.english: When he asked questions, the answers came back in Wall Street gobbledygook.
sentences.chinese: 他但凡提出疑問，得到的回答全是華爾街的官樣文章。

sentences.english: My attempt to get a new passport turned into a Kafkaesque nightmare.
sentences.chinese: 我試圖申請新護照的過程變成了一場官樣文章的噩夢。

sentences.english: Barroso was also scathing about the red tape surrounding the negotiations.
sentences.chinese: 巴羅佐還嚴厲批評了環繞談判所做的官樣文章。

sentences.english: If this sounds like gobbledygook, it kind of is.
sentences.chinese: 這聽起來確實有點像是官樣文章。

sentences.english: Of course, those words are gobbledygook on the whole.
sentences.chinese: 這些話自然是官樣文章。

sentences.english: Of course, those words are gobbledygook on the whole.
sentences.chinese: 這些話當然是官樣文章。
